arm_group.description: Controlled release oxycodone test formulation 40 mg
Immediate release oxycodone reference drug 20 mg

brief_summary.textblock:
To determine whether the bioavailability of the controlled-release test formulation is at
      least as high as that for the commercial reference drug.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Randomized, Two-way, Crossover Study to Estimate the Relative Bioavailability of a Controlled-release Formulation of Oxycodone (40 mg) With Sequestered Naltrexone Compared With Immediate-release Oxycodone Tablets (20 mg) in Healthy Volunteers

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  healthy volunteers, greater than 50 kg, able and willing to sign informed consent

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Evidence of significant illness, condition affecting drug absorption, history of
             sleep apnea, and allergy to opioid drugs

intervention.description: single dose administration of test formulation under fasted conditions
single dose administration of reference drug under fasted conditions

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

clinical_study.official_title: An Open-label, Single-dose, Randomized, Two-way Crossover Study to Estimate the Relative Bioavailability of a Controlled-release Formulation of Oxycodone (40 mg) With Sequestered Naltrexone Compared With Immediate-release Oxycodone Tablets (20 mg) in Healthy Volunteers

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

primary_outcome.measure: pharmacokinetic endpoints - area under the concentration curve (AUC)

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Peak concentration (Cmax) and time to peak concentration (Tmax)

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case-Crossover, Time Perspective: Prospective
